channel.title: Focusing on Solutions a Positive Discipline Podcast
channel.description: Positive Discipline is a program that teaches important social and life skills, in a manner that is respectful to both the adults and the young people. Visit http://www.positivediscipline.com/ for more information.
channel.copyright: All rights reserved. Empowering People Inc.

image.title: Positive Discipline is a program that teaches important social and life skills, in a manner that is respectful to both the adults and the young people.

channel.media:copyright: All rights reserved. Empowering People Inc.
channel.itunes:author: Ken Ainge
channel.itunes:subtitle: Positive Discipline is a program designed to teach young people to become responsible, respectful and resourceful members of their communities. Based on the best selling Positive Discipline books by Dr. Jane Nelsen, Lynn Lott, Cheryl Erwin, Kate Ortolano,
channel.itunes:summary: Positive Discipline is a program designed to teach young people to become responsible, respectful and resourceful members of their communities. Based on the best selling Positive Discipline books by Dr. Jane Nelsen, Lynn Lott, Cheryl Erwin, Kate Ortolano, Mary Hughes, Mike Brock, Lisa Larson and others, it teaches important social and life skills in a manner that is deeply respectful and encouraging for both children and adults (including parents, teachers, childcare providers, youth workers, and others).

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #49 (Workshop Results)
item.description: Dr. Jane Nelsen interviews Marianne McGinnis who shares some results of using the techniques she learned while attending a Teaching Parenting workshop. Some of her comments can be read at: http://blog.positivediscipline.com/2007/10/workshop-results.html

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #47 (Positive Time-Out - You First)
item.description: Create a positive time out plan for yourself. It could be a soak in the tub, getting in the shower (where kids can’t follow), going into the bathroom, locking the door, and turning on the stereo, taking a short walk (if your kids are old enough), sitting on the floor in the lotus position and chanting, whatever works for you. Let your kids know your plan and that you will use it when you need to calm down. Be sure they know this is "for" you, not "against" them. http://blog.positivediscipline.com
item.author: podcast@positivediscipline.com (Ken Ainge)

It could be a soak in the tub, getting in the shower (where kids can’t follow), going into the bathroom, locking the door, and turning on the stereo, taking a short walk (if your kids are old enough), sitting on the floor in the lotus position and chanting, whatever works for you. Let your kids know your plan and that you will use it when you need to calm down. Be sure they know this is "for" you, not "against" them. http://blog.positivediscipline.com

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #46 (Taming Temper Tantrums)
item.description: My guest for the latest Positive Discipline Radio podcast, Focusing on Solutions, was Aisha Pope, and LCSW from San Diego with Families Forward-East where she teaches Positive Discipline Parenting classes. She shared two wonderful success stories, followed by some comments from me. http://blog.positivediscipline.com

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #44 (Family Meetings)
item.description: Dr. Nelsen talks about her favorite Positive Discipline tool. Holding regular Family Meetings is one of the most valuable things you can do as a family. item.title: Focusing on Solutions #40 (Alec Baldwin’s Tirade at his Eleven-Year-Old daughter)
item.description: What can Parents Learn from It? By Jane Nelsen, www.positivediscipline.com Who hasn’t been shocked by listening to Alec Baldwin berate his 11-year-old daughter on a voice mail message that went on and on and on. Alec screamed insults at his daughter, he called her names, and he threatened her. No need to mention any more details. You’ve probably heard it all by now. blog.positivediscipline.com

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #32 (Empowering Teenagers Workshop)
item.description:
This workshop, presented by Lynn Lott and Jane Nelsen, and narrated by John Dupree, originally sold as seven, 60 minute, cassette tapes.
Digitally re-mastered for improved sound quality, this workshop is now available as downloadable MP3 audio files.
A study guide is often referred to in the recordings and will soon be available as an e-book. Every one who purchases these MP3 files will be notified when the study guide (workbook) is available.
The Positive Discipline for Teenagers book (formerly titled I’m on Your Side) is a great companion to this workshop. You might want to read the book and listen to these recordings now to become familiar with the concepts, and listen again when the workbook is available to help you refine the many suggested parenting tools for practical application with your teens.
Parts 2-14 can be purchased here. http://positivediscipline.com/Teen_Workshop/

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #29 (www.familymattersradio.libsyn.com)
item.description: Does Positive Discipline Really Work? Part 1 Whining, fighting, backtalk. Does this sound like your kids? Jacquie and Caroline talk about the secret formula to end power struggles with rebellious teens and misbehaving children without resorting to spankings or grounding with Dr. Jane Nelsen, author of Positive Discipline.

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #28 (How Positive Discipline started)
item.description: Dr. Jane Nelsen discusses how she got started with Positive Discipline. What inspired her to write the first Positive Discipline Book? She also briefly explains each of the Positive Discipline Books. Positive Discipline in the Classroom is explained and how to conduct a class meeting. Topics of positive discipline, is spanking a valid form a discipline. Jane explains how to use Positive Discipline A-Z to solve discipline issues. Rewards, do they work? Time-out is explained, how to use it effectively. Reference: http://www.positivediscipline.com/articles/I%20Was%20Punished.html
item.author: podcast@positivediscipline.com (Ken Ainge)

item.title: Focusing on Solutions #25 (Developing Capable Students.)
item.description: Jane Nelsen interviews Mike Brock and discuss the book "7 Strategies for Developing Capable Students" http://www.empoweringpeople.com/store/page3.html The number one goal of every parent and educator is to help children become successful adults. To achieve this goal children must learn self-discipline, responsibility, and judgment the very same principles that help them become good students. But how do we teach such essential concepts in today's complex and temptation-filled world? Nationally acclaimed educators Glenn and Brock are renowned for their Developing Capable People workshops. Here they show you how to help children become more confident, motivated, respectful, and emotionally stable. 7 Strategies for Developing Capable Students can help you develop the skills necessary for your child to become a capable adult. No parent or educator should be without this invaluable book!.
